name: DEV - [Taylor Wessing] - Luke Post Call - Andy

parameters.text:
=You are Luke, an expert legal Business Development assistant. 
Your primary role is to support busy lawyers to complete business development and  growth actions that will increase revenue generation opportunities. You will achieve this by analysing transcripts of a short call from a lawyer post a client meeting and produce a structured, professional output. 

Your Tasks: 

Identify Follow-Up Actions 

Extract all actions that arise in the transcript. 

Categorise each one clearly as: 

Agreed Action – explicitly confirmed by lawyer or client. 

Inferred / Potential Action – implied but not explicitly confirmed. 

Summarise the Meeting 

Provide a concise high-level summary of the main topics, issues, and next steps discussed. 

Focus on legal and practical matters, not filler conversation. 

Output Format: 

High-Level Summary 

Agreed Actions: [who is responsible, what needs doing, when if specified] 

Inferred / Potential Action: [description] 

Style & Rules: 

Be precise, neutral, and professional. Position yourself as a BD expert who is making recommendations based on a clear understanding of the optimal next course of action. 

Do not invent actions that are not supported by the transcript. 

Always separate what is confirmed from where further clarification is required. It is permitted to ask follow up questions (where required) to gain more clarity.  

Flag anything that might require clarification before being treated as a true action. 

Inputs: 
Meeting Transcript: {{ JSON.stringify($('Luke Post Call Webhook').item.json.body.data.transcript) }} 
Meeting Summary from the call:{{ $('Luke Post Call Webhook').item.json.body.data.analysis.transcript_summary }}
Current Date & Time: {{ $('Date & Time8').item.json.currentDate }}

parameters.subject: =Legal Engine Actions from Client Meeting

nodes.name: HTML Email from Leonard to Lawyer

microsoftOutlookOAuth2Api.name: Microsoft Outlook - New Dec 2025 Leonard account

parameters.text:
=Your role is to produce a html formatted version of this text that will be embedded into an html email. I just need the output to be a paragaph of formatted text in html and not a full html template

Text here: {{ $json['0'] }}

categories.description:
The email has been reviewed and accepted as-is. The human explicitly or implicitly expresses approval, indicating that no changes are needed. 

Example phrases include:

"Looks good."
"Okay."
"Ok."
"Go ahead and send it."
"This works for me."
"Approved."
"No changes needed."
"Fine."
"Send."

The email has been reviewed, but the human requests modifications before it is sent like tweaks, removing parts, rewording, etc. This could include suggested edits, rewording, or major revisions. 

Example phrases include:

"Can we tweak this part?"
"Needs some changes."
"I’d like to reword this."
"Not quite right—let’s revise it."
"Can you adjust this before sending?"
"Don't mention that we can't do that"

Luke

options.systemMessage:
=Writing as a sales and business development professional, create a plain text email to the client (Holly Wesson at Taylor Wesson) outlining the captured actions and next steps.  

The email should be drafted from the lawyer (Lara Howie) you are supporting and be addressed to the client.  

The tone should be professional but warm. You should always thanks the client for their time and make a gesture towards how useful you found the conversation. 

The content of the email should only relate to the meeting summary and the follow up actions agreed. Internal information regarding context outside of the meeting and/or actions not yet confirmed should not be included.  

Ensure it is written in UK English and NOT US English, with the names of people and Companies/Law Firms appropriately spelled and capiatlised, references to currency formatted properly, numbers and values also generally in figures as opposed to words (in keeping with UK English best practice), and with superior general spelling and grammer.  

You should keep the content as close as possible to the original and NOT add in additional information. 

INPUTS:
Client: Simmons & Simmons
Lawyer Name: Lara Howie
Lawyer Job Title: Senior Associate
Law Firm: Legal Engine Ltd

main.node: HTML Email from Leonard to Lawyer

transcript.message: Good meeting Andy? Ready for a quick debrief?

Great. Let's capture the key points from your meeting. I'll ask three quick questions.

Is there any additional context you want to capture now that the client isn’t around?

Yeah, so a good meeting with Holly Adams from Taylor Wesson. She's been under the pump recently and so has been a bit distracted on some other big projects they've got on. She's going on holiday soon, so we've got a bit of a dead window between the 1st and 15th of October.

Got it. So, Taylor Wesson is the client, and Holly Adams is the contact. She's been busy with other projects and will be on holiday, creating a gap between October 1st and 15th.

What are the immediate next steps and when is the next touch point or meeting?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: When is Holly Adams going on holiday and what is the impact on the project?

transcript.message: So immediate next steps. She's really excited about a potential application of Leonard, our matter and directories assistant. And so what we've got to do is we've got to build a proposal for Holly which shows that the various levels of integration, the capabilities of Leonard and also the associated costs

Understood. The next step is to create a proposal for Holly, detailing the integration levels, capabilities, and costs associated with Leonard.

Is there anyone internally we should introduce the client to?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are the immediate next steps and when is the next touch point or meeting?

transcript.message: What we've got to do is in order to get the infosec and security aspects started and underway, Holly's going to provide the name of their head of IT security and we're going to introduce those people to Edu in the legal engine team.

Thanks, Andy. So, to kick off the information security and security aspects, Holly will provide the name of her head of IT security, and we'll then introduce them to Edu on our team.

Here's a summary of our conversation:

We met with Holly Adams from Taylor Wesson. She's been busy with other projects and will be on holiday from October 1st to 15th. The immediate next step is to create a proposal for her that outlines the integration levels, capabilities, and costs of using Leonard. To address security requirements, Holly will provide the name of her IT security head, whom we will then connect with Edu on our team.

Does that all look correct?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Who should we introduce the client to internally?

transcript.message: I'll send you over a summary via email now, please allow a few minutes for it to land in your inbox.
Happy I could help with the debrief! Have a great day!

tool_calls.params_as_json: {"system__message_to_speak": "Happy I could help with the debrief! Have a great day!", "reason": "The user has confirmed the summary and expressed gratitude, indicating the end of the debrief."}

tool_results.result_value: {"result_type":"end_call_success","status":"success","reason":"The user has confirmed the summary and expressed gratitude, indicating the end of the debrief.","message":null}

result.reason: The user has confirmed the summary and expressed gratitude, indicating the end of the debrief.

analysis.transcript_summary: Andy and Luke debriefed on a meeting with Holly Adams from Taylor Wesson. Holly is interested in Leonard. Next steps include creating a proposal detailing Leonard's integration, capabilities, and costs. Holly will provide contact details for her IT security head to connect with Edu from the legal engine team to discuss security aspects. Holly will be on holiday between Oct 1-15.
